intro: Heeria longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed heeria, is a climbing shrub native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of flowering plants. The plant features opposite, elliptical leaves that are usually dark green and glossy. Its small, fragrant flowers are typically white or pale yellow and are borne in clusters. Heeria longipes is often used in traditional medicine and as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and growth habit.
